com.github.uberroot.ncjbot

Class LocalNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.LocalNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UnsafeObject<LocalNode>

    public final class LocalNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements UnsafeObject<LocalNode>

    This is the core of the NCJBot. It is responsible for loading and handling all modules and components of NCJBot.

    Additionally, this class is responsible for starting, monitoring, and signaling jobs running on this node. For more on the loading and running of individual jobs, see JobEnvironment.

    The supporting classes use this class as a proxy for all communication, retrieving the instances of each other from this class.

    Author:
    Carter Waxman

      • LocalNode

        private LocalNode()
           throws java.lang.Exception

      • addDiscoveredNode

        public boolean addDiscoveredNode(RemoteNode rn)

        Refreshes the status of the given node and adds it to the active node list if it is not already there.

        Parameters:
        rn - The node to add / refresh.
        Returns:
        False if the node already existed in the active node list, true if it did not.

      • startJob

        public long startJob(java.lang.String classPath,
            java.lang.String className,
            RemoteNode source,
            java.lang.String remoteTid,
            java.io.File initData,
            boolean cleanup)

        Starts a new job on its own thread with the given parameters.

        Parameters:
        classPath - The path to the running directory for the job to be created. This is also the path to the class file for the job.
        className - The name of the LocalJob subclass to run.
        source - The node that sent the job, or null if it was locally created.
        remoteTid - The thread id of the remote job that sent the job, or null if it was locally created.
        initData - Initialization parameters for the job to be created.
        cleanup - Whether to delete the class files and directory after it finishes running.
        Returns:
        The thread id of the new job, or -1 on failure.

      • sendData

        public void sendData(java.lang.String destTid,
            java.lang.String sourceTid,
            RemoteNode source,
            java.io.File data)

        Delivers data from a remote job to a job running on this node.

        Parameters:
        destTid - The thread id of the destination job running on this node.
        sourceTid - The thread id of the source job for the data.
        source - The node from which the data originated
        data - The data to deliver.

      • announceFoundNode

        public void announceFoundNode(RemoteNode rn)

        Alerts the jobs currently running on this node to a new node on the network.

        Parameters:
        rn - The discovered node.

      • announceNodeFailure

        public void announceNodeFailure(RemoteNode rn)

        Alerts the jobs currently running on this node to a failure of a node on the network. This indicates that the job should assume everything running on that node was lost.

        Parameters:
        rn - The node that failed.
